Question Text: When APs are placed at different geographic locations, they can all be interconnected by a switched infrastructure. The 802.11 standard calls this an extended service set (ESS).
LLM Explanation: The statement is true. When access points (APs) are placed at different geographic locations, they can be interconnected by a switched infrastructure to form an extended service set (ESS). An ESS is a set of one or more interconnected basic service sets (BSSs) and integrated local area networks (LANs) that appear as a single BSS to the logical link control layer at any station associated with one of those BSSs. This allows users to roam between APs while maintaining seamless connectivity.
URLs: ['IEEE 802.11-2016 - IEEE Standard for Information technology—Telecommunications and information exchange between systems Local and metropolitan area networks—Specific requirements - Part 11: Wireless LAN Medium Access Control (MAC) and Physical Layer (PHY) Specifications', 'CWNA Certified Wireless Network Administrator Study Guide by David D. Coleman and David A. Westcott']

Question Text: A lightweight access point in which one of the following architectures participate?
Choices:
a. Tunnel-MAC
b. Split-MAC
c. Big-MAC
d. Light-MAC
LLM Explanation: In a lightweight access point architecture, the Split-MAC design is used. In this model, some MAC layer functions are handled by the access point, while others are processed by a central wireless LAN controller (WLC). This allows for centralized management and control of the wireless network.
URLs: ['CCNA Wireless 200-355 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 3: Understanding a Basic Cisco Wireless LAN Architecture', 'Cisco Press: Deploying Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers, Chapter 1: Cisco Unified Wireless Network Architecture Overview']

Question Text: Which of the following controller ports is used to connect to a peer controller for high availability (HA) operation?
Choices:
a. Service port
b. Distribution system port
c. Console port
d. Redundancy port
LLM Explanation: The redundancy port on a wireless LAN controller is used to connect to a peer controller for high availability (HA) operation. This dedicated port allows the active and standby controllers to synchronize their configurations and maintain a heartbeat. The other ports have different purposes: the service port is for out-of-band management, the distribution system port connects to the wired network, and the console port is for local CLI access.
URLs: ['Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration Guide, Release 8.10 - High Availability chapter', 'CCNP and CCIE Enterprise Core ENCOR 350-401 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 15: High Availability']

Question Text: Which of the following wireless security tools is used to protect the integrity of data in a wireless frame?
Choices:
a. EAP
b. MIC
c. WEP
d. WIPS
LLM Explanation: MIC (Message Integrity Check) is a wireless security tool used to protect the integrity of data in a wireless frame. It is a hash function that creates a checksum or hash value based on the contents of the frame. The receiving device recalculates the MIC and compares it with the one included in the frame. If they match, it confirms the frame has not been altered in transit, thus ensuring data integrity.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 2, by Wendell Odom', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless-mobility/wireless-lan-wlan/68005-wlan-security.html']

Question Text: Wi-Fi is based on ________________ IEEE standards.
LLM Explanation: Wi-Fi is based on the IEEE 802.11 standards. The 802.11 standards define the protocols and specifications for wireless local area networks (WLANs) operating in the 2.4 GHz, 5 GHz, and 6 GHz frequency bands. The other options listed (802.12, 802.1, and 802.2) are not related to Wi-Fi standards.
URLs: ['IEEE 802.11 Wireless Local Area Networks: https://www.ieee802.org/11/', 'Wi-Fi Alliance: https://www.wi-fi.org/discover-wi-fi/wi-fi-standards', 'Cisco Networking Academy: CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 26: Fundamentals of Wireless Networks']

Question Text: Which of the following bridges can be used to provide wireless connectivity to a non-wireless device?
Choices:
a. Transparent bridge
b. Workgroup bridge
c. Wireless repeater
d. Adaptive bridge
LLM Explanation: A workgroup bridge can be used to provide wireless connectivity to a non-wireless device. It acts as a client to a wireless access point and provides Ethernet ports to connect wired devices, enabling them to join the wireless network.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Volume 1 by Wendell Odom', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/wireless/aironet-1200-access-point/prod_brochure09186a00801f7d0b.html']

Question Text: Which controller interface type maps a WLAN to a VLAN?
Choices:
a. Virtual interface
b. Redundancy management
c. Management interface
d. Service port interface
e. Dynamic interface
LLM Explanation: A dynamic interface on a wireless LAN controller maps a WLAN to a VLAN. It is used to route traffic between VLANs and WLANs. Each dynamic interface is mapped to a VLAN ID, and WLANs are mapped to the dynamic interface. This enables client traffic from different WLANs to be kept separate.

Question Text: Which is the most preferred and secure way of connecting to a WLC GUI to configure a new WLAN?
Choices:
a. FTP
b. SSH
c. HTTP
d. None of the above
e. HTTPS
LLM Explanation: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is the most preferred and secure way to connect to a Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) GUI for configuring a new WLAN. HTTPS uses SSL/TLS encryption to secure the communication between the client and the server, protecting sensitive information such as login credentials and configuration data. FTP and HTTP are insecure protocols that transmit data in plain text, making them vulnerable to interception and tampering. SSH is a secure protocol but is typically used for command-line access rather than GUI configuration.
URLs: ['Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration Guide, Release 8.10 - Configuring Security Solutions: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-10/config-guide/b_cg810/security_solutions.html', 'Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration Best Practices: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/wireless/4400-series-wireless-lan-controllers/107369-wlc-config-best-practice.html']

Question Text: The maximum configurable number of WLANs on a controller is __________________.
LLM Explanation: The maximum configurable number of WLANs on a Cisco wireless LAN controller is 512. This allows for a large number of separate wireless networks to be configured and managed through a single controller device.
URLs: ['Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration Guide, Release 8.10 - https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-10/config-guide/b_cg810/wlan_parameters.html', 'CCNA Wireless 200-355 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 6: Understanding Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers - https://www.ciscopress.com/store/ccna-wireless-200-355-official-cert-guide-9781587144578']

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi standards use the 5 GHz band? (Choose all that apply)
LLM Explanation: The IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi standards that use the 5 GHz band are:a. 802.11ax (Wi-Fi 6): Operates in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.b. 802.11ac (Wi-Fi 5): Operates exclusively in the 5 GHz band.c. 802.11n: Operates in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.d. 802.11a: The first Wi-Fi standard to use the 5 GHz band.The other standards listed (802.11g, 802.11b, and the original 802.11) only operate in the 2.4 GHz band.
URLs: ['IEEE 802.11 Wireless Local Area Networks: The Working Group for WLAN Standards. (n.d.). Retrieved from https://www.ieee802.org/11/', 'Wi-Fi Alliance. (n.d.). Wi-Fi Generations. Retrieved from https://www.wi-fi.org/discover-wi-fi/wi-fi-generations']

Question Text: Wi-Fi commonly uses the 2.5GHz and __________________ GHz bands.
LLM Explanation: Wi-Fi commonly uses the 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequency bands. The 2.4GHz band is more widely supported but prone to interference, while the 5GHz band offers faster speeds and less interference but shorter range.

Question Text: Choose the term that best describes a Cisco wireless access point that operates in a standalone, independent manner.
Choices:
a. Standalone Access point (AP)
b. Cisco Access Point (AP)
c. Autonomous Access Point (AP)
d. Independent Access Point (AP)
LLM Explanation: The term that best describes a Cisco wireless access point operating in a standalone, independent manner is Autonomous Access Point (AP). An autonomous AP has all the configuration settings within the AP itself and does not rely on a wireless LAN controller for management. It operates independently to serve wireless clients.
URLs: ['Cisco Press CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Chapter 26: Wireless LANs', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/access_point/15-3-3/configuration/guide/cg15-3-3/cg15-3-3-chap1-overview.html']

Question Text: You are creating a new WLAN with the controller GUI, which of the following parameters are necessary? (Choose two)
Choices:
a. IP subnet
b. SSID
c. Interface
d. BSSID
e. VLAN number
LLM Explanation: When creating a new WLAN with the controller GUI, the two necessary parameters are the SSID (Service Set Identifier) and the VLAN number. The SSID is a unique identifier for the wireless network that client devices use to connect. The VLAN number is required to map the WLAN to a specific VLAN for network segmentation and traffic management. The IP subnet, interface, and BSSID are not mandatory parameters when creating a new WLAN.
URLs: ['CCNA 200-301 Official Cert Guide, Wendell Odom, Cisco Press, 2020', 'https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/9800/config-guide/b_wl_16_10_cg/wlan.html']

Question Text: Which one of the following is a wireless encryption method that is not recommended for use due to vulnerability issues?
Choices:
a. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)
b. Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP)
c. Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP)
d. Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA)
LLM Explanation: Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) is a wireless encryption method that is not recommended for use due to known vulnerabilities. WEP has several security flaws that make it relatively easy for attackers to crack the encryption and gain unauthorized access to the wireless network. The other options - AES, EAP, and WPA - are more secure encryption methods or authentication protocols that are widely used and recommended for wireless security.
URLs: ['CISSP All-in-One Exam Guide, 8th Edition by Shon Harris and Fernando Maymí', 'CompTIA Security+ SY0-601 Exam Cram by Diane Barrett and Martin Weiss', 'IEEE 802.11 Wireless LAN Standard']

Question Text: Which of the following IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi standards use the 2.4 GHz band? (Choose all that apply)
LLM Explanation: The IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi standards that use the 2.4 GHz band are:a. 802.11g - operates in the 2.4 GHz band and provides data rates up to 54 Mbps.b. 802.11b - operates in the 2.4 GHz band and provides data rates up to 11 Mbps. c. 802.11n - can operate in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands, providing data rates up to 600 Mbps.d. 802.11 - the original Wi-Fi standard, operates in the 2.4 GHz band with data rates up to 2 Mbps.The other options (802.11ac, 802.11ax, and 802.11a) primarily use the 5 GHz band.
